sub_title: There's no complex problem, only complex solutions.
summary: I am a technology architect, technical product manager and (technical) team leader with a demonstrated R\&D record. I have worked with several technologies including cloud, BPMN, Enterprise Service Bus (ESB), message queues, data event hubs, ETL, Blockchain technologies, mobile, geometric modeling and image processing. In addition, I have a great deal of experience in software project management, technology architecture, agile development. I am skilled in several programming languages and frameworks including C\#, C++, Swift, Typescript/Javascript, Node.js/Nest.js, Java, PHP, mobile technologies, scientific programming. I am a mentor, a teacher and make things work. I am always in the quest for new opportunities and challenges.

tools used are C#, .Net (Core), WPF, SQL, Powershell, Azure cloud, Intune MDM.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Dr Georgios (Yiorgos)', 'last_name': 'Stylianou', 'name': None, 'headline': "There's no complex problem, only complex solutions."}]}, {'title': 'Product owner; Solution architect; Team lead', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'description': 'Managing the development and deployment to 50 US stores of a Hearing Screener running in two platforms: Web and Windows/Kiosk. Leading a team of BPMN and Java engineers. We focus on updating, developing and deploying

BPMN Engine, Java, Camel, ActiveMQ.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Dr Georgios (Yiorgos)', 'last_name': 'Stylianou', 'name': None, 'headline': "There's no complex problem, only complex solutions."}]}, {'title': 'Digital decoupling', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'Project manager; Distributed Messaging Engineer
Designed and implemented several Apache Kafka sink connectors that are deployed in AWS cloud via Terraform and Gitlub CI/CD and saved data into RDS, Datalake, InfluxDB (time-series). In addition, implemented lambda functions in order to assist the overall architecture.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Dr Georgios (Yiorgos)', 'last_name': 'Stylianou', 'name': None, 'headline': "There's no complex problem, only complex solutions."}]}, {'title': 'Pension Fund Transfer using Blockchain', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'Project manager; architect; developer for Blockchain
During this very succesful project we architected and developed from scratch a Blockchain based Pension Fund Transfer System that connects various Dutch Pension Fund Providers and was based on Hyperledger Fabric. Other technologies/languages used were Rest APis, Node.js, Angular, Elastic, Azure cloud, Kubernetes. We have implemented all legal requirements such as GDPR and performed complete Security and Performance assessments. The project triggered an investor funded start-up.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Dr Georgios (Yiorgos)', 'last_name': 'Stylianou', 'name': None, 'headline': "There's no complex problem, only complex solutions."}]}, {'title': 'Pension Infrastructure - Blockchain', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': 'Project manager; architect; developer for Blockchain
The project aims to prove that Blockchain can be used as the backbone to support a unified Pension Infrastructure across the Netherlands. By the end of the project we have demonstrated that Pension funds, Employers, public organizations and people can be connected in near real-time thus optimizing Pension fund administration. The project was implemented using as main technologies Quorum Blockchain, Solidity smart contracts, C#, Angular, CI/CD pipelines and Agile software development.
I was working as a team lead, technology architect, smart contract and backend developer. My role was catalytic for the success as I was able to predict problems and resolve them on time.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Dr Georgios (Yiorgos)', 'last_name': 'Stylianou', 'name': None, 'headline': "There's no complex problem, only complex solutions."}]}, {'title': 'Fuel Finder CY', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'description': "Project Manager
The project's goal was to deliver a universal application for the iOS platform that was accessible from the Apple's App Store. The application's main task was to provide real-time information of the fuel prices in Cyprus. Other functionalities of the application include enhancement of the visibility of gas station price differences, enabling to user to find cheap fuel anywhere in Cyprus. The user can find fuel prices based on a custom radius from his current location, per city, per gas station company, per fuel type. The user can also watch the fuel price history per gas station, using beautifully designed charts. Furthermore, the user could save his/her personal preferences for quick lookup, and was receiving push notifications with news. The fuel prices were received every hour from a public system and saved in a cloud service.

The tool is composed of integration with a public system that provides fuel prices, a cloud service, composed of a database and REST API, to save the fuel prices, a service the sends the fuel prices from the public system to the cloud service every hour, and an iOS application that fetches and displays the prices per gas station. The tools/techniques used are: swift programming language, cron service, AWS, Php.

I was responsible for the technical, data and application architecture design as well as ensuring the implementation's quality, budget and deadlines were satisfied. In addition, I have created the maintenance plan.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Dr Georgios (Yiorgos)', 'last_name': 'Stylianou', 'name': None, 'headline': "There's no complex problem, only complex solutions."}]}, {'title': 'Breadcrumb Navigation', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'description': "Project Manager
This is a software system designed and implemented for iOS with focus on visually impaired users and accessibility and performs Simultaneous Localization and Mapping (SLAM). Novel SLAM algorithms have been developed that perform sensor based indoor positioning using a combination of the inertia sensors built-in the mobile device. These are accelerometer, magnetometer and gyroscope. In a nutshell, while the user is walking, the algorithms count the user's steps and automatically recognize relatively straight paths and turns and use them to generate a map and a set of instructions in real-time. It allows for navigation inside buildings. The user can create new paths or use existing paths that are shared by other users via a remote server. The user interacts with the mobile application and the map recorder or navigator using a combination of custom screen gestures, vibrations and sounds.

We have used iOS for the mobile application and a server for the route saving and sharing. We used Objective-C for programming the iOS application and Java, IIS for the Server. Agile development.
Responsibilities: I was the lead Technical Architect and Project Manager of a small team of 4 people.I have created the whole architecture, the plan and experiments for the SLAM algorithms development/testing and improving. As this was a scientific research project and not an industrial project we focused most on the SLAM algorithm development and on the user interface (UI) accessibility.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Dr Georgios (Yiorgos)', 'last_name': 'Stylianou', 'name': None, 'headline': "There's no complex problem, only complex solutions."}]}, {'title': 'Visionhunt', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'description': "The project aims to develop a vision aid tool for the blind and the visually impaired that uses the phoneâ€™s camera to detect colors, paper money, light sources and objects on the floor (dropped objects). The visual aid tool was actualized as a standalone mobile application for both Nokia Symbian and Apple phones. It's main characteristic was real-time processing of live video feeds, from the phone's camera, with response time within a second. 

Visionhunt was able to identify 30 colors, detect the 1, 5, 10, 20, 50 US Dollar bills, detect sources of light, such as switched-on lamps or televisions and identify dropped objects such as keys. The mobile application was fully accessible to the blind and the visually impaired through VoiceOver or Zoom.

We have used C++, Carbide IDE, Symbian OS for development for the Nokia Symbian phones,  Objective-C, Xcode IDE, iOS for development for Apple iPhones, Git for code repository.

I was responsible for all aspects of the software engineering cycle as well as managing the project. The team was working under my instructions and I have designed the application architecture. As the project's main challenge was the architectural concerns with focus on the performance and accuracy, during the project I performed research and invented suitable algorithms and techniques such that real-time processing was achieved with the required accuracy. In addition, I guided the team on how to develop them and guided them to create suitable experiments that were used to rate the efficiency of the algorithms such that the results could be used as feedback to improve the quality of the algorithms.

The results were quite rewarding. Not only the goals were achieved but also the software application was a success as it was sold to about 13 countries, won various awards and featured on BBC.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Dr Georgios (Yiorgos)', 'last_name': 'Stylianou', 'name': None, 'headline': "There's no complex problem, only complex solutions."}]}]
